page.title: 04Interesting Buildings
page.content: There has been{mill}in Mill Lane at {Abbot's Worthy}since at least the 10th century, when it was mentioned in the Domesday Book. Above the door is the date A.D.961. The present owner is called Mr.Hitchcock and it was last used for milking in 1910. Across the meadow from the bottom of the lane is the{Fulling Mill}which dates back to 1695 and is at present for sale with offers from Â£350,000. The Conder Company have modern offices in the grounds of a{Queen Anne house built in 1750 which was originally a farmhouse. This house was enlarged in 1906 by the then owner Mr. Austin, it still has the fireplaces with the original delft tiles. In{King's Worthy {Village}is the picturesque thatched {public house}"Cart and Horses" built in 1540.
